title: English (1886) Parallel Bible (KJV and RV)
description:
The 1886 Parallel-Column Edition Holy Bible presents a unique and insightful way to study the scriptures by juxtaposing two significant versions of the Bible: the King James Version (KJV) and the Revised Version (RV). This edition allows readers to compare and contrast these two influential texts side by side, offering a deeper understanding of the nuances and evolution of biblical translation.

The King James Version, completed in 1611, is renowned for its majestic language and has had a profound influence on English literature and religious life. The Revised Version, completed in 1885, was the first major revision of the KJV, undertaken by British scholars who sought to correct and update the language and to incorporate findings from more recent biblical scholarship and manuscripts discoveries.

By placing these versions in parallel columns, this edition provides a fascinating perspective on the development of biblical language and interpretation. It enables readers to see how certain passages and phrases have been rendered differently over time, reflecting changes in language, culture, and understanding of the biblical texts. This Parallel-Column Edition is not only a valuable tool for study and comparison but also serves as a testament to the enduring nature of the Bible and its continuous relevance in changing times.
